alert.note: Alert for Somerset (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 17 at 3:22AM EST until December 19 at 10:00AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 inches or more possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Somerset County. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Considerable travel disruptions are possible. The hazardous travel conditions could impact the Monday evening and Tuesday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow accumulation is most likely on the Laurel ridgetops and summits located to the west of Route 219. The combination of snow and blowing snow may cause significant reductions in visibility.
info.instruction: There is the potential for significant winter weather that may impact travel. Review winter weather safety and preparedness information at weather.gov/safety/winter.
